S-5.8] | | [http://laws.gnb.ca/en/ShowPdf/cs/L-6.pdf ''Liens on Goods and Chattels Act''], [http://laws.gnb.ca/en/ShowPdf/cs/M-6.pdf ''Mechanics' Lien Act''], [http://laws.gnb.ca/en/ShowPdf/cs/2011-c.225.pdf ''Storer's Lien Act''] | [http://laws.gnb.ca/en/ShowPdf/cs/W-12.5.pdf ''Woods Workers' Lien Act''] |- valign="top" | {{flag|Nova Scotia}} | [http://nslegislature.ca/legc/statutes/persprop.htm SNS 1995-96, c. 13] | [http://nslegislature.ca/legc/statutes/securtsf.htm SNS 2010, c. 8] | [http://nslegislature.ca/legc/statutes/bldersln.htm ''Builders' Lien Act''] | | [http://nslegislature.ca/legc/statutes/woodmens.htm ''Woodmen's Lien Act''] |- valign="top" | {{flag|Prince Edward Island}} | [http://www.gov.pe.ca/law/statutes/pdf/p-03_1.pdf SPEI 1997, c.33, also referred to as c. P-3.1] | | | [http://www.gov.pe.ca/law/statutes/pdf/g-01.pdf ''Garage Keepers' Lien Act''], [http://www.gov.pe.ca/law/statutes/pdf/m-04.pdf ''Mechanics' Lien Act''], [http://www.gov.pe.ca/law/statutes/pdf/w-01.pdf ''Warehousemen's Lien Act''] | |- valign="top" | {{flag|Newfoundland and Labrador}} | [http://assembly.nl.ca/Legislation/sr/statutes/p07-1.htm SNL 1998, c. P-7.1] | [http://assembly.nl.ca/Legislation/sr/statutes/s13-01.htm SNL 2007, c. S-13.01] | | [http://assembly.nl.ca/Legislation/sr/statutes/m03.htm ''Mechanics' Lien Act''], [http://assembly.nl.ca/Legislation/sr/statutes/w02.htm ''Warehouser's Lien Act''] | |- valign="top" | {{flag|Yukon}} | [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/peprse.pdf RSY 2002, c. 169] | [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/securtrans.pdf SY 2010, c. 16] | [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/buli.pdf ''Builders Lien Act''] | [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/gakeli.pdf ''Garage Keepers Lien Act''], [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/wakeli.pdf ''Warehouse Keepers Lien Act''] | [http://www.gov.yk.ca/legislation/acts/mili.pdf ''Miners Lien Act''] |- valign="top" | {{flag|Northwest Territories}} | [https://web.archive.org/web/20140418224559/http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/pdf/ACTS/Personal%20Property%20Security.pdf SNWT 1998, c.8] | [http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/Legislation/..%5CPDF%5CACTS%5CSecurities%20Transfer.pdf SNWT 2009, c.14] | | [http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/Legislation/..%5CPDF%5CACTS%5CGarage_Keep_Lien.pdf ''Garage Keepers Lien Act''], [http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/Legislation/..%5CPDF%5CACTS%5CMechanics%20Lien.pdf ''Mechanics Lien Act''], [http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/Legislation/..%5CPDF%5CACTS%5CWare_Keep_Lien.pdf ''Warehouse Keepers Lien Act''] | [http://www.justice.gov.nt.ca/Legislation/..%5CPDF%5CACTS%5CMiners_Lien.pdf ''Miners Lien Act''] |- valign="top" | {{flag|Nunavut}} | As NWT | [http://www.justice.gov.nu.ca/i18n/English/legreg/pdf_sr/Legislation/Securities%20Transfer%20Act,%20S.Nu.%202010,%20ch.15..pdf SNu 2010, c. 15] | | As for NWT | As for NWT |}
==Debtor protection provisions==
===Stay of proceedings=== No person may terminate or amend — or claim an accelerated payment or forfeiture of the term under — any agreement, including a security agreement, with a bankrupt individual by reason only of the individual's bankruptcy or insolvency.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 84.2 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-63.html}}</ref> Similar provision is made with respect to any insolvent person upon filing a notice of intention or a proposal,<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 65.1 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-33.html}}</ref> as well as for any debtor company subject to the CCAA by reason only that proceedings commenced under the CCA or that the company is insolvent.<ref>{{Cite web|title = CCAA, S. 34(1) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-36/page-20.html}}</ref> Because of these restrictions on what are called ''"ipso facto"'' clauses, creditors must be careful in specifying appropriate trigger events in their contracts' termination clauses.<ref>{{Cite web| author = Stephen J. Weisz |title = Insolvency and Restructuring Agreements in an Economic Downturn | url = http://www.blakes.com/english/publications/RI/pdf/Paper139.pdf | publisher = [[Blake, Cassels & Graydon]] | date = April 2009 | accessdate = 2011-09-07}}</ref> The Canadian courts have extended this further through application of the common law principle of [[anti-deprivation rule|fraud upon the bankruptcy law]], declaring that termination clauses that are triggered where non-payment of obligations is indirectly caused by the debtor's insolvency should be deemed to have been caused by the insolvency.<ref>{{cite web|title = Beware Contractual Provisions triggered (even indirectly) by a Party's Insolvency|author = Anthony Alexander|url = http://www.canadianappeals.com/2013/03/06/the-second-opinion-beware-contractual-provisions-triggered-by-a-partys-insolvency/|date = 2013-06-06|publisher = [[McCarthy Tétrault]]|accessdate = 2013-11-04}}, discussing {{cite CanLII|litigants=Aircell Communications Inc. v. Bell Mobility Cellular Inc.|link=|year=2013|court=onca|num=95|format=|pinpoint=|parallelcite=|date=2013-02-14|courtname=|juris=}}, which extended upon {{cite CanLII|litigants=C.I.B.C. v. Bramalea Inc.|link=|year=1995|court=onsc|num=7420|format=canlii|pinpoint=|parallelcite=|date=1995-12-13|courtname=auto|juris=}}</ref>
A notice of intention <ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 50.4 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-25.html}}</ref> or a Division I proposal <ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 62(1) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-30.html}}</ref> will automatically create a stay of proceedings and "no creditor has any remedy against the debtor or the debtor's property, or shall commence or continue any action, execution or other proceedings, for the recovery of a claim provable in bankruptcy". Similar provision is also made on the bankruptcy of any debtor.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 69.3 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-51.html}}</ref> Directors of insolvent companies that have filed a notice of intention or a proposal have similar protection.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 69.31 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-52.html}}</ref>
===Suspension of attachments===
S. 70(1) of the ''BIA'' provides that bankruptcy orders and assignments take precedence over "all judicial or other attachments, garnishments, certificates having the effect of judgments, judgments, certificates of judgment, legal hypothecs of judgment creditors, executions or other process against the property of a bankrupt,"<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 70 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/section-70.html}}</ref> but that does not extend to:
:* those that have been completely executed by payment to the creditor or the creditor's representative, or :* the rights of a secured creditor.
The [[Ontario Court of Appeal]] has ruled that, in the case of a "requirement to pay" under the ''Income Tax Act'' (Canada) that was issued after a notice of application to appoint a receiver (but before the court heard the application), supported by an ''[[ex parte]]'' "jeopardy order" issued by the [[Federal Court (Canada)|Federal Court of Canada]] under s. 225.1(1) of that Act,<ref>{{cite web|title = ''Income Tax Act'', R.S.C., 1985, c. 1 (5th Supp.), s. 225.1(1)|url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-3.3/section-225.1.html}}</ref> the "requirement to pay" was considered to have been completely executed on the date of its issue, and thus took precedence over other creditors' claims.<ref>{{cite CanLII|litigants=I. Waxman & Sons Limited (Re)|link=|year=2010|court=onca447|num=|format=|pinpoint=|parallelcite=|date=2010-06-17|courtname=|juris=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title = Canada Revenue Agency Trumps Unsecured Creditors!|url = http://www.weirfoulds.com/canada-revenue-agency-trumps-unsecured-creditors|publisher = Weir Foulds LLP|date = October 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title = Case Comment – Re I. Waxman & Sons Ltd.|url = http://www.casselsbrock.com/CBArticle/Case_Comment____i_Re_I__Waxman___Sons_Ltd___i_|publisher = Cassels Brock|date = 14 October 2010}}</ref>
===Contractual arrangements===
Contracts may be assigned elsewhere in the event of a notice of intention of a Division I proposal,<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 66(1.1) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-37.html}}</ref> bankruptcy<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 84.1 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-63.html}}</ref> or CCAA proceeding.<ref>{{Cite web|title = CCAA, S. 11.3 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-36/page-9.html}}</ref> Agreements of any kind can be disclaimed in the event of a Division I proposal<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 65.11 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-34.html}}</ref> or CCAA proceeding,<ref>{{Cite web|title = CCAA, S. 32 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-36/page-19.html#h-10}}</ref> as well as leases in a bankruptcy proceeding.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 30(1)(k) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-15.html}}</ref>
Critical suppliers may be ordered to continue dealing with companies undergoing a CCAA proceeding, if the goods or services supplied are critical to the company's continued operation.<ref>{{Cite web|title = CCAA, S. 11.4 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-36/page-9.html}}</ref>
==Anti-avoidance provisions==
===Attacking questionable behaviour===
As in other countries, certain debtors may be tempted to bypass the process outlined above through the transfer of assets from an insolvent company to a [[phoenix company]], thus abandoning outstanding liabilities to creditors. Recent legal developments have made this procedure unattractive, through creditors using the [[oppression remedy]] available under the CBCA and similar provincial corporations legislation.<ref>{{Cite web| author = Mark Wiffen |title = getting blood from a stone – enforcing unpaid corporate judgments against directors | url = http://www.mcmillan.ca/95997 | publisher = [[McMillan LLP]] | date = July 2011 | accessdate = 2011-09-04}}</ref>
Several procedures are available for investigating companies' behaviour during times of insolvency or other financial difficulty. The BIA provides for examination of relevant parties during the administration of the estate,<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, SS. 161-167 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-85.html#h-47 | accessdate = 2011-09-15}}</ref> and the CBCA and similar provincial corporations legislation provides for the court to appoint inspectors to investigate and report back on fraudulent, dishonest, oppressive or unfairly prejudicial behaviour of a corporation.<ref>{{Cite web|title = CBCA, Part XIX | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-44/page-74.html#h-27 | accessdate = 2011-09-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web| author = Edmond F.B. Lamek and Andrew Derksen |title = OBA Remedies Fast Forward - OBCA (and CBCA) Inspectors | url = http://www.fasken.com/files/Publication/10ff42fd-2a1b-425c-ad7f-25cc5d879f0c/Presentation/PublicationAttachment/fdd631fe-9cc3-42e5-b023-30a0c09714d3/OBCA_and_CBCA_Inspectors.pdf | publisher = [[Fasken Martineau]] | accessdate = 2011-09-15}}</ref> A typical inspector's report can be viewed [http://documentcentre.eycan.com/eycm_library/Carling%5CEnglish%5CInspector%27s%20Reports%5CCarling%20Inspector%20-%201st%20Report%20-%20Aug%2016%20with%20Appendices.pdf here.]<ref>{{Cite web| title = Carling (Inspector under Business Corporations Act) | url = http://documentcentre.eycan.com/Pages/Main.aspx?SID=28 | publisher = [[Ernst & Young]] | accessdate = 2011-09-15}}</ref>
The court has power to remove one or more of the company's directors, if the court is satisfied that the director is unreasonably impairing or is likely to unreasonably impair the possibility of a viable proposal (or in the case of the CCAA, a compromise or arrangement) being made in respect of the company or is acting or is likely to act inappropriately as a director in the circumstances.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, s. 64 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-31.html}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = CCAA, s. 11.5 | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/C-36/page-10.html}}</ref>
===Protection of creditors===
Where bankruptcy is sought, it does not necessarily wipe the slate clean on certain debts. Some liabilities are not released upon discharge.<ref>{{Cite web|title = BIA, S. 178(1) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/B-3/page-93.html}}</ref> Directors and parties related to the bankrupt may still be held personally liable for certain tax debts,<ref>{{Cite web| author = Katherine M. Wellburn and Murray Jamieson |title = Taking it all away - Traps set for debtors trying to dodge the taxman | url = http://www.canadianlawsite.ca/Bankruptcy_Paper_Taxes.pdf | date = 2008-09-18 | accessdate = 2011-08-25}}</ref>{{efn|Whether through non-arm's-length transfers of property at less than fair market value when the debt is outstanding<ref>{{cite CanLII|litigants=Canada v. Heavyside|link=|year=1996|court=fca|num=3932|format=3932|date=1996-12-09|courtname=auto|juris=}}</ref> or distribution of property from the estate without a clearance certificate.<ref>{{cite web|author = Jean-Gillaume Schooner|title = GST/QST - A tax debtor's bankruptcy or arrangement does not extinguish the obligation to obtain a clearance certificate from a tax authority|url = http://www.stikeman.com/cps/rde/xchg/se-en/hs.xsl/18624.htm|publisher = [[Stikeman Elliott]]|date = September 29, 2014}}, discussing ''Congiu c. Canada'', [http://www.canlii.org/fr/ca/caf/doc/2014/2014caf73/2014caf73.html 2014 CAF 73 (CanLII)] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20150131164225/http://www.canlii.org/fr/ca/caf/doc/2014/2014caf73/2014caf73.html |date=2015-01-31 }}{{Fr icon}} and ''Congiu c. Agence du revenu du Québec'', [http://www.canlii.org/fr/qc/qcca/doc/2014/2014qcca242/2014qcca242.html 2014 QCCA 242 (CanLII)]{{Fr icon}}. Leave to appeal refused, {{cite CanLII|litigants=Rita Congiu v. Agence du revenu du Québec|link=|year=2014|court=scc-l|num=51415|format=canlii|date=2014-09-04|courtname=auto|juris=}}</ref>}}and directors can be held accountable for other liabilities.<ref>{{Cite web| author = David A. DeGroot |title = Directors' liability during corporate insolvency | url = http://www.bdplaw.com/titanweb/bdp/bdpwebsite.nsf/AllDoc/8981B19B11CADABD852575ED006F9D18/$File/BDP%20Insolvency%20&%20Restructuring%20NL%20June%2009.pdf | publisher = Burnett, Duckworth & Palmer LLP | date = June 2009 | accessdate = 2011-09-04}}</ref>
Certain bankruptcy and CCAA proceedings involve the issue of unpaid wages, severance and termination pay, and other payroll liabilities. The ''[[Wage Earner Protection Program Act]]'' <ref>{{Cite web|title = Wage Earner Protection Program Act (S.C. 2005, c. 47, s. 1)) | url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/W-0.8/index.html | accessdate = 2011-09-04}}</ref> provides a procedure to claim a portion of the amount due, against which the "super-priority" of the employees on the assets of the estate is subrogated.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Wage Earner Protection Program | url = http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/eng/sc/wepp/index.shtml | accessdate = 2011-09-04}}</ref>
==See also== {{See also|Category:Companies that have filed for bankruptcy in Canada|Category:Insolvency law of Canada|Category:Canadian insolvency case law}}
*[[Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act]] *[[Companies' Creditors Arrangements Act]] *[[Insolvency law of Canada]]

{{Infobox software | name = Cubes | title = | logo = <!-- [[File:]] --> | screenshot = <!-- [[File:]] --> | caption = | collapsible = | author = Stefan Urbanek<ref>[http://www.stiivi.com/ Stefan Urbanek is the creator of Cubes and Data Brewery.]</ref> | developer = | released = {{Start date and age|2011|03|27}} | discontinued = | latest release version = 1.1 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2016|07|02}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = Active | genre = [[OLAP]] | license = [[MIT License]]<ref name="license-github">{{cite web|url=https://github.com/DataBrewery/cubes/blob/master/LICENSE|title=DataBrewery / cubes / blob / master / LICENSE|accessdate=21 February 2015|publisher=Github}}</ref> | website = {{URL|http://cubes.databrewery.org/}} }}
'''Cubes''' is a light-weight [[open-source software|open source]] multidimensional modelling and [[OLAP]] toolkit for development reporting applications and browsing of aggregated data written in [[Python Programming Language|Python programming language]] released under the [[MIT License]].
Cubes provides to an analyst or any application end-user "understandable and natural way of reporting using concept of [[OLAP cube|data Cubes]] – multidimensional data objects".
Cubes was first publicly released in March 2011. The project was originally developed for [[Government procurement|Public Procurements]] of [[Slovakia]].<ref>[http://tender.sme.sk/ Public Procurements of Slovakia] by [http://www.transparency.sk Transparency International Slovakia]</ref> Cubes 1.0 was released in September 2014 and presented on the PyData Conference in New York<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-FDTK80zsXc&spfreload=10 Cubes 1.0 Overview at PyData NYC 2014 (video)].</ref>
== Features == * [[OLAP]] and aggregated browsing (default is ROLAP) * logical model of [[OLAP cube]]s in [[JSON]] or provided from external sources * hierarchical dimensions (attributes that have hierarchical dependencies, such as category-subcategory or country-region) * multiple hierarchies in a dimension * [[Expression (mathematics)|arithmetic expressions]] for computing derived [[Measure (data warehouse)|measures]] and aggregates * [[Internationalization and localization|localizable]] metadata and data
== Model == The logical conceptual model in Cubes is described using [[JSON]] and can be provided either in a form of a file, directory bundle or from an external model provider (for example a database). The basic model objects are: [[OLAP cube|cubes]] and their measures and aggregates, dimensions and their attributes, hierarchies. Logical model also contains mapping from logical attributes to their physical location in a database (or other data source).
Example model:
<syntaxhighlight lang="javascript"> { "cubes": [ { "name": "sales", "label": "Our Sales", "dimensions": [ "date", "customer", "location", "product" ], "measures": [ "amount" ] } ] "dimensions": [ { "name": "product", "label": "Product", "levels": [ { "name":"category", "label":"Category", "attributes": [ "category_id", "category_label" ], }, { "name":"product", "label":"Product", "attributes": [ "product_id", "product_label" ], } ] }, ... ] } </syntaxhighlight>
== Operations == Cubes provides basic set of operations such as [[Data drilling]] and filtering ([[OLAP cube|slicing and dicing]]). The operations can be accessed either through Python interface or through a light [[web server]] called Slicer.
Example of the python interface:
<syntaxhighlight lang="python"> import cubes
workspace = Workspace("slicer.ini") browser = workspace.browser("sales")
result = browser.aggregate()
print(result.summary) </syntaxhighlight>
== Server == The Cubes provides a non-traditional OLAP server with [[HTTP]] queries and [[JSON]] response [[API]]. Example query to get "total amount of all contracts between January 2012 and June 2016 by month":
<tt> <nowiki>http://localhost:5000/cube/contracts/aggregate?drilldown=date&drilldown=criteria&cut=date:2012,1-2012,6&order=date.month:desc</nowiki> </tt>
The response looks like:
<syntaxhighlight lang="javascript"> { "summary": { "contract_amount_sum": 10000000.0 }, "remainder": {}, "cells": [ { "date.year": 2012, "criteria.code": "ekonaj", "contract_amount_sum": 12345.0, "criteria.description": "economically best offer", "criteria.sdesc": "best offer", "criteria.id": 3 }, { "date.year": 2012, "criteria.code": "cena", "contract_amount_sum": 23456.0, "criteria.description": "lowest price", "criteria.sdesc": "lowest price", "criteria.id": 4 }, ... "total_cell_count": 6, "aggregates": [ "contract_amount_sum" ], "cell": [ { "type": "range", "dimension": "date", "hierarchy": "default", "level_depth": 2, "invert": false, "hidden": false, "from": ["2012", "1" ], "to": ["2015", "6" ] } ], "levels": { "criteria": [ "criteria" ], "date": [ "year" ] } } </syntaxhighlight>
The simple HTTP/JSON interface makes it very easy to integrate OLAP reports in web applications written in pure [[HTML]] and [[JavaScript]].
The Slicer server contains endpoints describing the [[OLAP cube|cube]] metadata which helps to create generic reporting applications<ref>[https://github.com/jjmontesl/cubesviewer Cubes Viewer]</ref> that don't have to know the database model structure and conceptual hierarchies up-in-front.
The Slicer server is written using the [[Flask (web framework)]].
== ROLAP and SQL == The built-in [[SQL]] backend of the framework provides [[ROLAP]] functionality on top a relational database. Cubes contains a [[SQL]] query generator that translates the reporting queries into SQL statements. The query generator takes into account [[topology]] of the [[Star schema|star]] or [[snowflake schema]] and executes only joins that are necessary to retrieve attributes required by the data analyst.
The SQL backend uses [[SQLAlchemy]] Python toolkit to construct the queries.
== See also == {{Portal|Free software|Python programming}} * [[SQLAlchemy]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * {{Official website|cubes.databrewery.org}}

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Eduardo Maruri Miranda |image = Eduardo Maruri Profile.jpg |office = President and CCO, Maruri GREY Ecuador |term_start = November, 1991 |term_end = Present Time |office2 = President Barcelona Sporting Club |term_start2 = November, 2007 |term_end2 = December, 2010 |predecessor2 = [[Galo Roggiero]] |successor2 = [[Juan Carlos Estrada]] |office3 = President, Cámara de Comercio de Guayaquil |term_start3 = June, 2004 |term_end3 = June, 2006 |predecessor3 = [[Joaquin Zevallos]] |successor3 = [[María Gloria Alarcón]] |office4 = VicePresident, UNO Political Party |term_start4 = February, 2006 |term_end4 = June, 2007 |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|09|06|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Guayaquil]], [[Ecuador]] |death_date = |death_place = |alma_mater = [[Eastern Michigan University]] |parents = Silvia Miranda Roca, Diego Maruri Rodríguez |residence = [[Guayaquil]] |religion = [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholicism]] |website = [http://www.maruri.ec www.maruri.ec] }}
'''Eduardo Maruri Miranda''' (born September 6, 1966, [[Guayaquil]], [[Ecuador]]) is an Ecuadorian businessman, President and Founding Member of MARURI [[Grey Global Group]] Ecuador [http://www.maruri.ec/],<ref>http://www.grey.com/ecuador/</ref> and former President of the [[Barcelona Sporting Club]] Soccer Team of Ecuador.
The company he leads, Maruri GREY Ecuador, was the first Ecuadorian Advertising Agency to receive a Gold Lion at the [[Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity]] in 2012,<ref name="eluniverso1">[http://www.eluniverso.com/2012/06/18/1/1356/agencia-maruri-consigue-premios-festival-cannes-publicidad.html Agencia Maruri consigue premios en festival de Cannes de publicidad, El Universo]</ref><ref>[http://www.metroecuador.com.ec/27882-maruri-logra-un-hito-para-ecuador-al-ganar-un-leon-de-oro-y-otro-de-bronce-en-el-festival-de-cannes-de-publicidad.html Maruri logra un hito para Ecuador, al ganar un León de Oro y otro de Bronce en el Festival De Cannes de publicidad, METRO Ecuador]</ref> 5 Awards in 2013,<ref name="telegrafomix">[http://www.telegrafo.com.ec/tele-mix/item/agencia-maruri-gano.html Agencia Maruri ganó 5 leones en el Festival de Cannes, El Telégrafo]</ref> and 9 Awards in 2014.<ref name="eluniverso2">[http://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2014/07/05/nota/3188706/agencia-local-gana-nueve-leones-festival-cannes Agencia Maruri gana nueve leones en festival de Cannes, El Universo]</ref>
== Maruri GREY Ecuador ==
Eduardo Maruri earned a [[Bachelor of Business Administration]] (BBA) degree from [[Eastern Michigan University]] in 1986 and a Certificate in [[Communication]]s degree from [[Harvard University]] in 1989.
In 1991, along with his father, Jimmy Maruri, he founded Maruri Publicidad (nowadays called Maruri GREY Ecuador), a company focused on Communication Services and Advertising, ATL, BTL, Production, Digital, PR, Marketing, Planning and Research, among other services.<ref>[http://www.maruri.ec/ Maruri GREY Ecuador Official Website]</ref>
In 2011, the company received the Gran Condor de Oro Award for their Campaign with Aceite Sabrosón, which featured Ecuadorian singer [[Delfin Quishpe]].<ref>[http://www.elcomercio.com/negocios/Maruri-quedo-Gran-Condor_0_531546922.html Maruri se quedó con el Gran Cóndor 2011, El Comercio]</ref> In addition, Maruri GREY was named Agency of the Year by the Association of Advertising Agencies of Ecuador.<ref>[http://expreso.ec/expreso/plantillas/nota.aspx?idart=6573971&idcat=19308&tipo=2 Una publicidad más madura, Expreso]</ref>
In 2012, the Agency received two Awards at the [[Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity]], including a Gold Lion in the PR Category for the CIMA-Yasuní Campaign.<ref name="eluniverso1"/> As this was the very first Award Ecuador received from this Festival up to that date, it was donated to the Museum of the Ecuadorian Presidency, and Phillip Thomas, CEO of the Festival attended the event of the donation.<ref>[http://www.andes.info.ec/es/cultura/5733.html El León de Oro obtenido en Cannes por la agencia Maruri sobre la Campaña Yasuní-ITT fue donado al Museo de Carondelet, Agencia ANDES]</ref> As a result, Eduardo was invited to Cala on CNN Latin America, an important TV Show of the network, to talk about his achievements on Cannes that year.<ref>[http://rumberos.net/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=26948:esta-semana-en-cala-por-cnn-en-espanol-eduardo-maruri-marisa-brel-susana-gimenez-y-leonardo-padron&catid=32:gente&Itemid=174 Esta semana en Cala por CNN en Español: Eduardo Maruri, Marisa Brel, Susana Giménez y Leonardo Padrón, Rumberos]</ref>
Afterwards, in 2013, Maruri GREY won again on the [[Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity]], this time 5 Awards, including a Gold Lion.<ref name="telegrafomix"/> Also in that year, the company was awarded with the Gran Condor de Oro for the Campaign "Buena Memoria Multi C-Brina".<ref>[http://www.hoy.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/maruri-grey-gana-el-festival-de-publicidad-condor-de-oro-589808.html Maruri Grey gana el festival de publicidad Cóndor de Oro, HOY]</ref>
In 2014, Maruri GREY received 9 Awards at the [[Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity]].<ref name="eluniverso2"/> In April of that year, Eduardo Maruri participated in the Regata de [[Posorja]] with the Fatty [[baseball]] team.<ref>[http://www.eluniverso.com/deportes/2014/04/19/nota/2769461/adn-volvio-coronarse Eduardo Maruri participó en la Regata Guayaquil - Posorja, El Universo]</ref> In the November issue of Revista Vistazo, Maruri was placed at the 81st position in the Ranking of the Most Prestigious [[Entrepreneurs]] of [[Ecuador]].<ref>[http://vimo.com.ec/revistas/VISTAZO/vistazo1134/ Ranking de Empresarios de Mayor Prestigio en Ecuador, Revista Vistazo]</ref>
Maruri sponsored the visits to Ecuador of many renown personalities such as [[Bill Clinton]], George H. W. Bush, [[Mijaíl Gorbachov]], Martin Luther King Jr., [[José María Aznar]], [[Rigoberta Menchú]], among others. In 2010, he organized the Primera Cumbre Internacional del Medio Ambiente CIMA, which hosted [[Al Gore]].
In 2015, Maruri Grey Ecuador was once again the most creative and war winning agency in the country, obtaining 12 [http://www.insights.la/2015/07/10/maruri-grey-conquista-cannes-lions/ CANNES LIONS]: 3 golden lions, 3 silver and 6 bronze for their clients Panasonic, Ministry of Tourism, Natures Garden and Chevrolet.
This same year, in the twelfth [http://www.insights.la/2015/10/06/estrategias-que-valen-oro-3/ Effie awards Ecuador 2015], Maruri won silver in the category food, drinks and liquors with the campaign ‘’Tarrinita’’ for La Fabril S.A
Followed by 14 [http://www.quebakan.com/v15/spot-de-directv-sillon-de-amigos-se-consagra-como-el-mejor-comercial-del-ano-en-el-festival-condor-de-oro-2015/ Condor Awards] in múltiple categories, including best TV commercial of the year "Sillón de Amigos" for Directv.

==Barcelona Sporting Club== He was elected President of the [[Barcelona Sporting Club]] soccer team from Guayaquil for the 2007-2011 period.<ref>[http://www.eluniverso.com/2007/11/23/0001/15/6620B50A617D4C398116F07499B8D9B6.aspx eluniverso.com - Maruri ganó las elecciones - Nov. 23, 2007 - DEPORTES<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In the 2008 season Maruri led the team to a 5th place in the [[Ecuadorian Serie A]]. On December 22, 2010 Maruri resigned the presidency of Barcelona after a surprise press conference alongside his family and fellow friends. Maruri stated that he was leaving Barcelona due to "Family issues", then Maruri said,"We were born to be champions, I'm not the man who abandons his ship in a horrible thunderstorm and is about to be sunken underwater, I know better days will come for Barcelona".<ref>[http://ediciones.expreso.ec/ediciones/2010/12/23/deportes/futbol/maruri-se-fue-sin-lograr-su-sueno// Maruri se fue sin lograr su sueño]; Diario Expresso, 22 December 2010</ref>
== Additional Data ==
In 2004, Eduardo Maruri won the Elections for the Presidency of the Chamber of Commerce of Guayaquil. He was the Youngest President in the history of that Institution.<ref>[http://www.eluniverso.com/2004/05/19/0001/9/BAB1228E32C44E9B97FF7BD0C5B7EE2E.html Así ganó Eduardo Maruri, El Universo]</ref> In his two years of management, the number of affiliated companies doubled, and 90% of these scored his work as excellent.<ref>[http://americo.usal.es/oir/Elites/curriculums/Ecuador/maruri_miranda.pdf Eduardo Maruri Miranda, Asambleísta por Guayas]</ref>
Later, in 2006, he was elected unanimously as the President of the National Federation of Chambers of Commerce of Ecuador, by the 85 Chambers of the country.
"Lideres" Magazine described him as one of the most respected businessmen of Ecuador<ref>[http://www.revistalideres.ec/marketing/Festival-premios-lions-comunicacion-maruri-creativo_0_1174682530.html Los leones ocupan más espacio en su estantería de galardones, Líderes Ecuador]</ref> and "Latin Finance" magazine highlighted him as the only Ecuadorian between the Top 25 Latin American Businessmen able to take over important offices over the next 10 years.Maruri was the VicePresident of the Political Party "[[Una Nueva Opción]]-UNO". In September 2007, he was elected to be a part of the National Assembly of Ecuador, being the top voted candidate of his city, Guayaquil.<ref>[http://www.eluniverso.com/2008/05/23/1212/1220/09B89D4299F6434D9EDE40B43F2630B8.html Eduardo Maruri Miranda, El Universo]</ref> On November of the same year, he won the Presidency of Barcelona Sporting Club, one of the most important Soccer Teams of Ecuador,<ref>[http://www.eluniverso.com/2007/11/22/0001/15/8F0D77BB54B949A6ADAB37C39036619D.html Maruri es el nuevo presidente de Barcelona, El Universo]</ref> and managed to get the team to succeed at Basketball.<ref>[http://www.hoy.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/barcelona-se-aduena-de-la-liga-nacional-de-basquet-305436.html Barcelona se adueña de la Liga Nacional de Básquet, HOY]</ref>
*Director, [[Junta Cívica de Guayaquil]].<ref>[http://www.juntacivica.org.ec/directorio.html Directorio 2009 - 2011]</ref> *Director, [[Hospital de Niños León Becerra]]. *Marketing and Sales Teacher in several Universities. *Director, [[Corporación de Seguridad Ciudadana de Guayaquil]].<ref>[http://cscg.gov.ec/iquienes-somos/directorio Directorio de la CSCG]</ref> *Speaker of Political Communications [[George Washington University]]. *Part of the Baseball National Team *Triathlon and [[Ironman Triathlon|Ironman]] Champion in 2002.<ref>[[:m:w:en:List of Ecuadorian ironmen|Lista de los ''Iromen'' de Ecuador]]</ref>

'''Entrepreneur in Residence''' or '''Executive in Residence''' is a kind of position in [[venture capital]] firms, [[law firm]]s or [[business school]]s that is usually temporary and not formal. This is when an institution brings in an entrepreneur, who is usually in the process of starting or expanding his/her new company.<ref>An Entrepreneurial Life, (2013). What is an Entrepreneur in Residence?. [online] Available at: http://www.anentrepreneuriallife.com/glossary/entrepreneur-in-residence [Accessed 22 Oct. 2014].</ref><ref>Psychohistory, (2013). EIR Series: What is an Executive in Residence (EIR)?. [online] Available at: http://blog.adamnash.com/2013/07/05/eir-series-what-is-an-executive-in-residence-eir/ [Accessed 25 Oct. 2014]</ref><ref>So What The Heck Is An 'Entrepreneur In Residence' Anyway?. [online] Business Insider. Available at: http://www.businessinsider.com/eir-faq-what-you-need-to-know-2012-3[Accessed 24 Oct. 2014].</ref><ref>Rebelic.nl, (2014). Introducing the Entrepreneur in Residence. [online] Available at: http://rebelic.nl/2011/07/11/introducing-entrepreneur-in-residence/ [Accessed 26 Oct. 2014].</ref><ref>Forbes.com, (2014). Welcome to Forbes. [online] Available at: https://www.forbes.com/fdc/welcome_mjx.shtml [Accessed 24 Oct. 2014].</ref>
==Venture Capital firm== In a Venture Capital firm the entrepreneur is funded to work with some of the [[investment]] team of the company as well as being exposed to business-building processes, where he/she can assist the firm with any existing portfolio. In addition he/she is expected to help the company evaluate new potential investments, especially if it is an area of the E.I.R's experience. On the other hand, the company usually benefits from this by getting significant access to the new company started by the E.I.R. This is due to the fact that the company gets to, usually, be the first investor in E.I.R's new company, giving them a chance to influence some company decisions.<ref>Festanstellung - Entrepreneur in Residence (m/w) - München, Berlin - www.etventure.com, (2014). Festanstellung - Entrepreneur in Residence (m/w) - München, Berlin. [online] Available at: http://www.etventure.com/de/festanstellung-entrepreneur-in-residence-muenchen-berlin.html [Accessed 25 Oct. 2014].</ref>
==Law Firm== In a law firm scenario, the [[entrepreneur]] is expected to provide services to the firm’s clients who are also involved in entrepreneur activity. For a firm having an entrepreneur who can interact with other entrepreneurs and advise them is a way of gaining client trust by helping them with business decisions and networks. In addition Law firms can also have the previous E.I.Rs as their clients once they start up their company. This is an easy and accessible [[clientele]] with whom the companies had previous relationships. This is a very beneficial relationship for the E.I.R, who will develop relationships with several other entrepreneurs, that could be potential partners in the future. The E.I.R gets a chance to show his/her knowledge and understanding to the law firm's client and will develop further relationships with any partners of the client's partner as well. <ref>Available at: http://jobs.target.com/us/united-states/target.com-and-mobile/jobid6206907-entrepreneur-in-residence?apstr=26src%3DJB-10182 [Accessed 28 Oct. 2014].</ref>{{fv|date=June 2015}}<ref>Davis, K. (2014). Law firms are sponsoring incubators, cozying up with young entrepreneurs. [online] ABA Journal. Available at: http://www.abajournal.com/magazine/article/law_firms_are_sponsoring_incubators_cozying_up_with_young_entrepreneurs [Accessed 26 Oct. 2014].</ref>
==Business School== While in a Business school, an E.I.R is expected to provide guidance to business students who are intending to go through the same path as those who are helping them. The type of nurturing an E.I.R can provide to a business school environment helps students, professors or whoever wishes to start a business within the institution environment. The E.I.R helps them develop ideas, organize them and follow the right path towards making these ideas reality. E.I.Rs are usually interested in these types of opportunities for several reasons, including expanding their own [[Curriculum vitae|CV]] through teaching and influence as well as developing relationships with future business owners who could be future partners of the E.I.R.<ref>http://www..gsb.columbia.edu, (2014). Entrepreneur in Residence Program. [online] Available at: http://www8.gsb.columbia.edu/entrepreneurship/programs/entrepreneur-in-residence [Accessed 27 Oct. 2014].</ref><ref>Hbs.edu, (2014). Book an EiR, or Legal Office Hour Appointment - Entrepreneurship - Harvard Business School. [online] Available at: http://www.hbs.edu/entrepreneurship/resources/eir-scheduling.html [Accessed 24 Oct. 2014].</ref>

'''Gianluca Comin''' ([[Udine]], 2 April 1963) is the founder of Comin & Partners, a Communication and Public Relations company, focused in government affairs, communication, media relations and crisis communication. Since January 2016 he is also Board member of the [[Venice Biennale|Biennale di Venezia]].
Previously, until June 2014, he was Director of External Relations of [[Enel]] Group.<ref>[http://www.enel.com/en-GB/group/board/corporate_functions/ExtRel/ Gianluca Comin]. ENEL. Retrieved June 2011</ref> and Board's member of [[Endesa (Spain)|Endesa]] sa., a Spanish electricity Company that is part of the Enel Group.
Gianluca Comin started his professional career in 1986 as a journalist at the Rome office of the daily paper “[[Il Gazzettino]]”. Until 1997, he reported about politics from Rome and in 1998 he became Head of the Press Office of the Ministry of Public Works and spokesman for the Minister.
In 1999 Comin was appointed Director of External Relations and bureau chief at the Montedison S.p.A. Rome office, where he was in charge of communication for the IPO of Compart Montedison, of Compart Burgo, of Falck-Sondel at Compart-Montedison, of Fiat-Edf at Compart Montedison. At that time he was also managing and coordinating relations with Italian and EU institutional authorities.
In September 2001 he was named Head of Communication and Media Relations at [[Telecom Italia]]. His most significant activities included managing relations with the national and international media for the various companies of the Telecom Italia Group and coordinating of the corporate-financial press offices, Domestic Wireline, [[Telecom Italia Mobile|Tim]], Seat Group, It Telecom, and [[Telespazio]] press offices.
In 2002 he moved to Enel as Director of Communications in charge of advertising, media relations, events, internal communications, corporate identity, relations with the associations and corporate social responsibility.
Comin, who is a professional journalist, is visiting professor at [[LUISS University of Rome|LUISS University]] (Communication strategy and advertising) and lecturer at several universities and institutions including [[Bocconi University|Bocconi]] University and CSM (Consiglio Superiore della Magistratura – Superior Council of Magistracy).
He was member of the National Council of [[CONFINDUSTRIA|Confindustria]] and managing director of Enel Foundation and [[Enel Cuore]]. Former President of FERPI (the Italian Association of Public Relations), now he is member of the Executive Board. Former editor in chief of Oxygen <ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.enel.com/it-IT/media/magazines/oxygen/|title = Oxygen|date = |access-date = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref> and author of "2030 La tempesta perfetta", 2012, Rizzoli.
He has also been a member of the Ministry of Cultural Heritage Communication Committee and of the Ministry of Economy and Finance, in charge of selecting tender winners for integrated communication projects for Southern Italy, a board member of Syremont Spa (Montedison Group Company), a Member of the Committee to inform on the 2000 Jubilee. Moreover, he participated in the Presidency of the Council of Ministers and CCISS advisory Committee (Information on traffic Coordination Centre). In 2016 and 2017 he was a member of the Scientific Committee of the [[Corporate Art Awards]] organized by [[pptArt]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pptart.net/commitee2017|title=Corporate Art Awards - Scientific Committee}}</ref>.
== Publications ==
Gianluca Comin is the author of the following publications: * With Donato Speroni: ''2030 La Tempesta Perfetta - Come sopravvivere alla grande crisi" (Rizzoli, 2012) http://2030latempestaperfetta.it/ * ''Il modello di comunicazione integrata Enel'' (on “La comunicazione d’azienda”, Collesei -Ravà- Isedi, 2009); * ''I nuovi strumenti per la gestione del consenso'' (on “Co-opetition”, Simonetta Pattuglia e Sergio Cherubini, Franco Angeli, 2009); * ''La Comunicazione alla prova del web'' (on “Comunicare, un successo”, Igor Righetti, UTET, 2009); * ''Comunicare con gli eventi culturali: L'Estate di Raffaello'' (on “Comunicare con gli eventi”, Simonetta Pattuglia e Sergio Cherubini, Franco Angeli, 2007)

{{advert|date=April 2017}} '''GlobalVision''' is a [[Software as a service|SaaS]] software company specializing in packaging and labelling.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.packagingdigest.com/pharmaceutical-packaging/first-cloud-based-app-inspects-packaging-text-and-graphics|title=First cloud-based app inspects packaging text and graphics {{!}} Packaging Digest|website=www.packagingdigest.com|language=en|access-date=2017-03-31}}</ref>
{{Infobox company | name = GlobalVision | native_name = Global Vision Inc | logo = http://www.globalvisioninc.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/globalvision_wht.svg | type = Privately held company | founded = 1990 | hq_location_city = Montreal, Quebec | hq_location_country = Canada | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = Reuben Malz, CEO | website = {{URL|www.globalvisioninc.com}} }}
== History == Global Vision Inc. (GlobalVision) was founded in 1990 by Reuben Malz. It is headquartered in [[Montreal]], Canada, and has regional offices in the UK and Germany.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapid=681281|title=Global Vision, Inc.: Private Company Information |publisher=Bloomberg|website=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-03-30}}</ref> GlobalVision is an enterprise software company that develops and designs desktop and SaaS [[proofreading]] solutions for brand companies and their supply chains worldwide.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://industryanalysts.com/global-vision-contex-launch-quality-assurance-initiative-help-pharmaceuticals-others-avoid-costly-print-errors-packaging-labeling/|title=Global Vision, Contex Launch Quality Assurance Initiative to Help Pharmaceuticals and Others Avoid Costly Print Errors in Packaging and Labeling - Industry Analysts, Inc.|date=2015-06-30|work=Industry Analysts, Inc.|access-date=2017-03-29|language=en-US}}</ref>
In 2013 [[Pfizer]] contracted with GlobalVision for packaging quality control.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.packageprinting.com/article/global-vision-selected-by-pfizer-for-worldwide-deployment-of-automated-proofreading-solutions/|title=Global Vision Selected By Pfizer For Worldwide Deployment Of Automated Proofreading Solutions|work=Package Printing|access-date=2017-03-31|language=en-US}}</ref>
GlobalVision introduced its first web-based Quality Control Platform,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.printingnews.com/company/10857519/global-vision-inc|title=Global Vision Inc. Company and Product Info from PrintingNews.com|work=PrintingNews.com|access-date=2017-04-18|language=en}}</ref> QCanywhere, in 2013.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://info.qcanywhere.com/qcanywhere-honored-at-the-2013-accolades-award/|title=QCanywhere Honored at the 2013 Accolades Award - QCanywhere|work=QCanywhere|access-date=2017-04-13|language=en-US}}</ref> This was followed by the introduction of a more advanced version of the platform, Proofware, in 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bioprocessonline.com/doc/global-vision-proofware-cloud-packaging-inspection-suite-0001|title=Global Vision Releases Proofware The First All-In-One Cloud-Based Packaging Inspection Suite|website=www.bioprocessonline.com|language=en|access-date=2017-04-13}}</ref> In 2017, GlobalVision released a desktop Quality Control Platform.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.labelsandlabeling.com/news/new-products/globalvision-unveils-quality-control-platform|title=GlobalVision unveils Quality Control Platform {{!}} Labels & Labeling|website=www.labelsandlabeling.com|language=en|access-date=2017-04-13}}</ref>
== Regulations and requirements== GlobalVision is [[ISO 9001:2008]] certified.{{citation needed|date=May 2018}} GlobalVision's [[proofreading]] [[solution]]s meet the FDA 21 CFR Part 11 / Annex 11 requirements, which states that requirements for the technical and procedural controls that must be met by the regulated user if the regulated user chooses to maintain regulated records electronically. Part 11 was published in March 1997.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mastercontrol.com/newsletter/annex-11-21-cfr-part-11-comparison.html|title=Annex 11 and 21 CFR Part 11: Comparisons for International Compliance|website=www.mastercontrol.com|access-date=2017-03-28}}</ref> GlobalVision text comparison software has also met the compliance requirements set by the EMA ([[European Medicines Agency|European Medecines Agency]]).<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.realwire.com/releases/Global-Visions-Text-Comparison-Software-Docu-Proof-Recognized-by-the-EMA-for-Regulatory-Submissions|title=Global Vision {{!}} Global Vision's Text Comparison Software Docu-Proof Recognized by the EMA for Regulatory Submissions|date=2013-05-21|work=RealWire|access-date=2017-03-29|language=en-gb}}</ref>

[[Centre Party (Hungary)|Centrum]] (2001–2004) |}} {{eastern name order|Droppa György}} '''György Droppa''' (born 17 September 1947) is a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] environmentalist, politician and economist, who served as leader of several extra-parliamentary green political parties since the 1990s. ==Early life== After finishing university studies, Droppa started his career in the [[Catering|catering industry]], working for Panonnia, Danubius and Olimpia hotels. In 1982, he opened his first own restaurant (Fondue Bar) at the Keleti Károly St. which became a popular meeting place among the "democratic opposition" members who criticized the Communist regime. Droppa has enabled to extension of samizdat publications in his restaurant. By 1988, he established further three catering units (Katlan Club, Virányos Club and Jókai Club), where several opposition events and rallies took place. During the transition process, he was a founding member of the re-established Hungarian Catering Corporation. In June 2009, the 1956 Institute claimed Droppa, as a member of the opposition party SZDSZ, was one of the state authority's 181 informer agents at the reburial of [[Imre Nagy]] and his martyr companions on 16 June 1989.{{cite web|accessdate=2015-11-26|url=http://www.rev.hu/89/f?p=107:17:8731514528777296:RESET_PAGINATION:NO:RP,17:P17_PERSON_ID,P16_PERSON_TYPE:13525,3|title=Droppa György ügynöki adatlapja|date=}} Droppa rejected the accusation and expressed the possibility of a lawsuit. Later János M. Rainer, head of the institute backtracked from their standpoint and stated "there is no evidence that the state security organs did indeed looking for him and Droppa handed over reports."{{cite web|accessdate=2015-11-26|url=http://index.hu/belfold/1989/2009/06/12/droppa_szerint_o_nem_jelentett_barandyt_megkerestek_ezzel-azzal/?cp=7#comments|title=Tagad a besúgólista több szereplője|date=2009-06-12}} ==Political career== Droppa was one of the founders of the [[Duna Kör]] in 1984, which established as a protest body to prevent the construction of the [[Gabčíkovo–Nagymaros Dams]]. In 1990, he became chargé d'affaires of the organization. He joined the [[Alliance of Free Democrats]] (SZDSZ) for a short time in 1989. In November 1989, he participated in the foundation of the [[Green Party of Hungary]] (MZP). Following the radical right-wing ideological turnout within the party by 1993, Droppa and several other environmentalist members decided to quit the party to establish the [[Green Alternative (Hungary)|Green Alternative]] (ZA), with election of Droppa and [[Erzsébet Schmuck]] as its co-leaders. However the new party was unsuccessful at the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 1994|1994 parliamentary election]], receiving only 0.02 percent of the votes. In January 1994, the ZA was admitted into the [[European Federation of Green Parties]], which established under this name few months earlier. Despite the lack of domestic support, György Droppa was also elected to the European political party's leadership, holding his position as "key figure of the green politics" until 2009. In that capacity, Droppa established a good relationship with the [[GreenLeft]], a prominent Dutch member of the federation.{{sfn|Vida|2011|p=468}} Beside that, Droppa also served as Director of the ISTER – East European Environmental Research between 1993 and 1997. In September 1997, ZA joined the Union for Hungary electoral alliance, dominated by the [[Republican Party (Hungary)|Republican Party]], however it did not gain any seats in the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 1998|1998 parliamentary election]]. Following the defeat, Droppa and Márta Márczis were elected co-presidents of the ZA. On 3 June 2000, the ZA merged with the Social Democracy 2000 Foundation to form the [[Alliance of Green Democrats]] (ZDSZ).{{sfn|Vida|2011|p=467}} The ZDSZ joined the [[Centre Party (Hungary)|Centre Party]] (or Centrum), with Droppa elected to its leadership, for the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2002|2002 parliamentary election]], but remained unsuccessful.[[Dieter Nohlen|Nohlen, D]] & Stöver, P (2010) ''Elections in Europe: A data handbook'', p. 899. {{ISBN|978-3-8329-5609-7}} In the [[Hungarian local elections, 2002|2002 local elections]], Droppa was the Centrum's candidate for the position of [[Mayor of Budapest]], but received only 0.59 percent of the votes and came to the fifth place.{{sfn|Vida|2011|p=469}} On 16 November 2003, the ZDSZ transformed itself into a party alliance by merging several other minor movements. The Védegylet, the Clean Air Action Group and other environmentalist NGOs rejected Droppa's integration efforts. On 31 December 2004, the ZDSZ left the Centre Party.{{sfn|Vida|2011|p=470}} The party could run only one representative at the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2006|2006 parliamentary election]]. Droppa's leading role in the Hungarian section of the green movement had declined with the appearance and formation of the [[Politics Can Be Different]] (LMP). In reaction to this, the ZDSZ and the [[Workers' Party of Hungary 2006]], merged into the [[Green Left (Hungary)|Green Left]] and Droppa elected as its first president. However, despite the fact that LMP was not yet a member of the [[European Green Party]], its key leader [[Daniel Cohn-Bendit]] personally expressed his sympathy and support to the new green-liberal organization for the [[European Parliament election, 2009 (Hungary)|2009 European Parliament election]]. Cohn-Bendit said "I do not trust György Droppa anymore. For years, he keeps saying the same, and now it was enough. I do not see that there is a lot of chance to [Droppa] to take the necessary twenty thousand recommendation slips."{{cite web|accessdate=2015-11-26|url=http://magyarnarancs.hu/belpol/zoldpartok_magyarorszagon_-_orok_igeretek-71449|title=Zöldpártok Magyarországon - Örök ígéretek|date=2009-05-28}} Cohn-Bendit also criticized Droppa for his party having merged with a Marxist movement.{{cite web|accessdate=2015-11-26|url=http://blog.xfree.hu/myblog.tvn?n=zgfumag&pid=35980&blog_cim=%20%22El%20lehet%20t%E1vozni%20az%20EU-b%F3l%22|title=El lehet távozni az EU-ból|date=2009-05-03}} While LMP jumped over the electoral threshold in the [[Hungarian parliamentary election, 2010|2010 parliamentary election]], Droppa's Green Left received only 0.03% of the votes. Following the election, Droppa was replaced as party president by neo-Marxist philosopher [[Gáspár Miklós Tamás]].{{sfn|Vida|2011|p=468}} ==References== {{Portal|Hungary|Politics}} {{reflist}} ==Sources== *{{cite book |author-last=Vida |author-first=István | title=Magyarországi politikai pártok lexikona (1846–2010) ''[Encyclopedia of the Political Parties in Hungary (1846–2010)]'' |publisher=Gondolat Kiadó |year=2011 |pages= |chapter= |isbn=978-963-693-276-3|ref=harv|language=hu}} ==External links== *[http://kp.hu/droppa-gyorgy/ Biography], ''kp.hu'' {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Droppa, Gyorgy}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Hungarian economists]] [[Category:Hungarian environmentalists]] [[Category:Alliance of Free Democrats politicians]] [[Category:Politicians from Budapest]]

{{Infobox organisation | name = Institute of Directors | logo = IoDLogo(2015).jpg | image = Image:Building, Pall Mall - DSC04234.JPG | caption = Institute of Directors, [[Pall Mall, London]] | type = Professional organisation | founded_date = {{start date and age|1903}} | location = [[Pall Mall, London|Pall Mall]]
[[London]], [[SW postcode area|SW1]]
United Kingdom | key_people = [[Stephen Martin (businessman)|Stephen Martin]], Director General
[[Charlotte Valeur]], Chair | focus = Business | num_members = 30,500 | homepage = [http://www.iod.com iod.com] }} The '''Institute of Directors''' (IoD) is a business organisation for company directors, senior business leaders and entrepreneurs. It is the UK’s longest running organisation for professional leaders, having been founded in 1903 and incorporated by [[Royal Charter]] in 1906. The IoD, per its mission statement, stands for "[[free enterprise]], [[entrepreneurialism]], wealth creation and good [[corporate governance]]," and represents "the views of businesses and IoD members in the media and with government." {{Citation needed|date=August 2017}} The IoD is located in the [[Listed building|Grade I-listed building]] at 116 Pall Mall, formerly the [[United Service Club]]. Members of the IoD also gain access to co-working spaces around the UK, bespoke market intelligence, tailored tax and legal support, exclusive member-only events along with discounts on IoD professional development courses and events. From a high of 55,000 members in 2005, the IoD currently has just over 30,000 full members. Members of the IoD come from companies of all sizes and from all industries {{Citation needed|date=August 2017}}. Around 70% work for small and medium-sized enterprises and are typically in senior management and boardroom-level positions while 78% of [[FTSE 100 Index|FTSE 100]] companies have an IoD member on their board or in a senior management position. ==History & Royal Charter== The IoD was founded in 1903 and incorporated by royal charter in 1906.[http://www.iod.com/about-the-iod/our-royal-charter IoD Royal Charter] Retrieved 29 June 2015 The royal charter compels the IoD to: * Promote for the public benefit high levels of skill, knowledge, professional competence and integrity on the part of directors * Represent the interests of members and the business community to government and in the public arena * Encourage and foster a climate favourable to entrepreneurial activity and wealth creation * Promote the study, research and development of corporate governance ==Membership== The IoD represents individual members. Every member’s voice carries equal weight within the organisation, and members retain their membership of the IoD throughout their career. This allows the IoD free rein to speak out on behalf of the business community and discuss individual companies in public. There are currently 30,000 IoD members in the UK and Overseas, with an additional 2,500 student members. Anybody who has an interest in business, is running a business, sits on a board or runs their own company can join the IoD. In order to help address declining membership the IoD 99 was established in 2015. This initiative is aimed at members who under the age of 42, and gives a substantial discount on membership fees. Additionally IoD Advance was launched in March 2016, which gives additional benefits in return for a higher annual subscription. ==Policy== The IoD represents its members and makes the case for enterprise, entrepreneurialism and business in the public and to government. Working with various stakeholders, the IoD campaigns on issues of importance to its members and the wider business community to build an environment in the UK which supports businesses and makes is easy to start, grow and run a company. The IoD has experts on tax, infrastructure, law, Europe, corporate governance, financial services, technology, education, skills and regulation, and campaigns on all of these issues. ==Business support== The IoD’s Information and Advisory Services offer members tailored and bespoke business advice on all aspects of running a business, including unbiased and confidential legal, financial, HR, marketing, and tax support. Members of the IoD can access the support through online, telephone or face-to-face consultations, are allowed up to 25 different consultations each year. ==Training and development== The IoD is one of the country’s most prestigious training providers, and has a range of courses to suit business leaders at every stage of their career. There are role-specific training courses to equip directors with new skills to take on different roles along with the flagship Chartered Director course. [In other countries Certified Director, e.G. in [http://german-iod.org/ablauf/ Germany]] Training courses are open to both members and non-members alike, and around 5,000 people take part in an IoD course every year. The IoD networks also provide executive coaching, mentoring services and online learning zones. ==Initiatives and events== The IoD hosts hundreds of networking, policy and social events throughout the year and across the country. ===Annual Convention=== [[Image:Julia Gillard Mackworth 2015.jpg|thumb|right|[[Julia Gillard]] delivers the inaugural Mackworth Lecture at the IoD, 2015]] The Annual Convention is the flagship IoD event and a fixture of the business calendar and has historically taken place at the [[Royal Albert Hall]] each year. It draws some of the biggest business names and politicians and leaders from across the world. The convention has taken place every year since 1950. Nine different prime ministers have addressed the convention on more than eighteen occasions along with pioneers such as [[Jimmy Wales]], co-founder of [[Wikipedia]], and [[Richard Branson]], serial entrepreneur, and members of the British royal family, including the [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] and the [[Charles, Prince of Wales]]. The last Annual Convention took place in September 2016 and included former Greece finance minister [[Yanis Varoufakis]], Lord [[Norman Lamont]] of Lerwick, global economist [[Dambisa Moyo]], and [[Nicola Sturgeon]]. Owing to declining ticket and sponsorship revenues the Annual Convention took a year's break in 2017. It will take on a new look in March 2018, with the format and speaker line-up to be confirmed. ===Rhondda Lecture=== In 2015, the IoD launched the annual Rhondda Lecture, in honour of Viscountess Rhondda, the first female President of the IoD. The lecture celebrates radical thought, leadership, bold ideas and activism. [[Julia Gillard]], former Australian prime minister delivered the inaugural lecture in June 2015 at 116 Pall Mall to an audience of politicians, academics, and business leaders. [[Ruth Davidson]], leader of the Scottish Conservative party, gave the 2016 lecture and was interviewed by BBC journalist [[Laura Kuenssberg]] at 116 Pall Mall in December. ==''Director'' magazine== ''Director'' is a business and lifestyle magazine for business leaders. It is circulated bi-monthly, is free to IoD members and available to purchase through subscription. It contains interviews with business leaders and politicians, updates from the IoD, debates on topical issues, reviews and features. In April 2017 it was announced that the editorial, advertising and production functions of the magazine will be transferred over to SevenC3, a contract publisher. As a result, a number of members of staff were made redundant. This was followed by an announcement in October 2017 that the magazine would be cut back to only six issues per year. ==Structure & key people== The IoD is made up of regional divisions and branches across the UK which serve as the local point of contact for IoD members. At the national level, the IoD is governed by a board and a council, which serves as the voice of IoD members. Stephen Martin is the director general, having succeeded [[Simon Walker (business)|Simon Walker]] in October 2016. [[Barbara, Lady Judge]] became the IoD's first female chairman in May 2015. She promised to champion women and work to boost the number of women in senior executive positions across British business.[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/946a13d4-ce5f-11e4-900c-00144feab7de.html Lady Judge stirs things up at the UK’s Institute of Directors] Retrieved 29 June 2015. In September 2018, it was announced that she would be succeeded by [[Charlotte Valeur]].{{cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/sep/02/institute-of-directors-appoints-charlotte-valeur-as-chair|title=Charlotte Valeur succeeds Barbara Judge as IoD chair|first=Rupert|last=Jones|date=2 September 2018|website=the Guardian|accessdate=2 September 2018}} Internationally there are different organizations with the same target. In Germany, the [[ Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte]] exists as an active non profit organization.{{cite web|url=http://german-iod.org|title=Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte|author=|date=|website=Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte|accessdate=2 September 2018}} ==116 Pall Mall== The IoD occupy the Grade I listed 116 Pall Mall in London, which is open to members of the IoD, and has rooms and function suites available for commercial hire. The building is owned by the [[Crown Estate]], along with the large collection of artwork that decorates the rooms. Until 1978, the building was run by the [[United Services Club]]. The building was designed by [[John Nash (architect)|John Nash]], the 19th-century architect who also designed the [[Brighton Pavilion]] and [[Marble Arch]], and constructed between 1826-28. Between 2001 and 2014, members also had use of 123 Pall Mall. This was opened as a contemporary meeting space in contrast with the more traditional 116 Pall Mall, and the interiors were created by noted designers Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway. Despite its popularity with members, the building was closed in 2014 as part of cost saving measures. 116 Pall Mall has been used as a location for many films and TV programmes, including ''[[Gandhi (film)|Gandhi]]'', ''[[Foyle's War]]'', "[[Downton Abbey]]", "[[The Ali G Show]]", "[[Parks and Recreation]]" and ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]''. ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == *{{Official website|http://www.iod.com/ }} *[http://www.german-iod.org/ Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte (German IoD)] *[http://www.director.co.uk/ Director Magazine] {{Economy of the United Kingdom}} {{Authority control}} {{Coord|51|30|26|N|0|7|54.49|W|scale:1563_region:GB|display=title}} [[Category:Corporate governance in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Business and finance professional associations]] [[Category:Business organisations based in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Grade I listed buildings in the City of Westminster]] [[Category:Grade I listed institutional headquarters]] [[Category:Institute of Directors]] [[Category:Organisations based in the City of Westminster]] [[Category:Professional associations based in the United Kingdom|Directors]]

{{primary sources|date=November 2016}}
'''ICMA''' (International City/County Management Association) (originally International City Managers' Association)<ref>{{cite web |url= http://etext.ku.edu/view?docId=ksrlead/ksrl.kc.internationalcitycounty.xml;route=ksrlead;brand=ksrlead;query= |title= Guide to the ICMA Collection - International City/County Management Association records, 1900-2010 |publisher= University of Kansas Libraries |date= 2010 |accessdate= June 2016}}</ref> is an association representing professionals in [[local government]] management. It is based in [[Washington, D.C.]], [[United States|USA]].
Founded in 1914 as the International City Managers Association, ICMA provides education and networking opportunities for its members, and offers the Credentialed Manager program to offer professional [[credential]]ing to [[city manager|city and county executive managers]]. It also conducts research, provides technical assistance and training, and promotes professional local government management.<ref name="icma">{{cite web|url=http://icma.org/main/bc.asp?bcid=60&hsid=1&ssid1=17|title=About ICMA|accessdate=2008-12-13}}</ref>
The ICMA Voluntary Credentialing Program recognizes professional local government managers qualified by a combination of education and experience, adherence to high standards of integrity, and an assessed commitment to lifelong learning and professional development. Managers are recognized by ICMA through a peer review credentialing process, and this self-directed program offers an opportunity for interested ICMA members to quantify the unique expertise they bring to their communities. The program also assists ICMA members in focusing and reflecting upon their lifelong professional development experience. Members who participate in the program may earn the designation of ICMA Credentialed Manager granted by the ICMA Executive Board.
The ICMA is considered part of the '[[Big Seven (United States)|Big Seven]]', a group of organisations that represent local and state government in the United States.
==References== <references />
==External links== * [http://www.icma.org/ International City/County Management Association]

'''John Anthony Edwards Pottow'''<ref name="State Bar">[http://www.michbar.org/memberdirectory/detail.cfm?PID=82668 John Anthony Edwards Pottow—P74675], [[State Bar of Michigan]].</ref> is a professor of law at the [[University of Michigan Law School]], specializing in international [[commercial law]], [[bankruptcy]] and [[consumer protection|consumer finance]].<ref name="Michigan">[https://www.law.umich.edu/historyandtraditions/faculty/Faculty_Lists/Alpha_Faculty/Pages/JohnAEPottow.aspx John A. E. Pottow], University of Michigan Law School.</ref> Pottow has testified before Congressional committees on the subject of bankruptcy and consumer matters, and was one of three lawyers commissioned by the [[Troubled Asset Relief Program]] (TARP) [[Congressional Oversight Panel]] to offer outside expert legal opinions on the [[Home Affordable Modification Program]] and TARP.
==Early life and education== Pottow was born in Canada.<ref name="Pursglov">Sheila Pursglov. [http://www.legalnews.com/ingham/1353114 Professor helps students to tame the 'Wild West' of bankruptcy law] (June 7, 2012). ''Legal News''.</ref> He graduated from [[Upper Canada College]] in 1989.<ref>[http://issuu.com/uppercanadacollege/docs/ucc_oldtimes_summerfall2010 Announcements], ''Old Times'' 35 (Summer/Fall 2010).</ref> He received an [[Bachelor of Arts|A.B.]] ''[[Latin honors|summa cum laude]]'' in psychology, [[Phi Beta Kappa]],<ref name="LQN">[https://www.law.umich.edu/historyandtraditions/faculty/Faculty_Lists/Alpha_Faculty/Documents/Law_Quad_Notes/Van_Houweling_Molly_2002.pdf Faculty], ''Law Quadrangle Notes'' (summer 2002).</ref> from [[Harvard College]] in 1993,<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Regents">[http://www.regents.umich.edu/meetings/05-08/2008-05-IV-1/PDF%20files/Law/Pottow,%20John%20A.E..pdf Promotion Recommendation: The University of Michigan Law School (approved by the Regents on May 15, 2008)].</ref> While at Harvard, Pottow received the John Harvard Annual Scholarship all four years, and was awarded the Gordon Allport Prize in Psychology and the [[Thomas T. Hoopes, Class of 1919, Prize]].<ref name="LQN"/> Pottow also hosted a jazz program on [[WHRB-FM]], and was a member of the [[Hasty Pudding Theatricals]] group and [[College rowing (United States)|crew team]] and student conductor of the [[Harvard University Band]].<ref name="LQN"/><ref>Maya E. Fischhoff, [http://www.thecrimson.com/article/1992/4/4/housing-lottery-randomizes-12-plooking-alternately/ Housing Lottery Randomizes 12%] (Apr. 4, 1992), ''[[Harvard Crimson]]''.</ref> As a freshman, Pottow attended the last lecture ever delivered by [[B. F. Skinner]].<ref name="Pursglov"/> Pottow was interested in [[psycholinguistics]] and studied under social psychologist [[Roger Brown (psychologist)|Roger Brown]], who encouraged Pottow to pursue the practice of law.<ref name="ResGestae"/><ref>[http://oasis.lib.harvard.edu/oasis/deliver/~hua14002 Correspondence between Brown and Pottow] is included in the Papers of Roger W. Brown, 1954-1997, Box 18, at the Harvard University Archives.</ref> He was also a student under professor [[Elizabeth Warren]], which later developed into a professional collaboration.<ref>Margie Kelley, [http://www.law.harvard.edu/news/bulletin/2002/summer/feature_4-1.html Teaching Lessons] (Summer 2002), ''Harvard Law Bulletin''; ''see also'' Shira Schoenberg, [http://www.masslive.com/politics/index.ssf/2012/05/elizabeth_warrens_harvard_coll.html At Harvard, Elizabeth Warren known as tough, demanding, dynamic professor] (May 13, 2012). MassLive.com/[[The Republican (Springfield)|''The Republican'']].</ref>
From 1993 to 1994, Pottow worked at Eos Partners, [[Limited partnership|LP]], a [[private equity]] [[hedge fund]] in New York, as [[chief financial officer]].<ref name="ResGestae">Mike Murphy and Matt Nolan, "[http://students.law.umich.edu/rg/main/04_12_05.pdf Our Neighbor from the North: A Chat with Professor Pottow, Eh?]," ''Res Gestae'', Vol. 55, No. 16 (Apr. 12, 2005).</ref><ref name="CV">[http://www.iiiglobal.org/administrator/components/com_juser/upload_files/j_pottow@iiiglobal.org_Pottow,%20John%20bio.doc John A. E. Pottow - Biography], International Insolvency Institute.</ref>
Pottow earned his [[Juris Doctor|J.D.]] ''magna cum laude'' from [[Harvard Law School]], where he was treasurer of the ''[[Harvard Law Review]]'', in 1997.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Pursglov"/> At Harvard Law School, Pottow was a National Scholar.<ref name="LQN"/> Between his first and second years of law school, Pottow was a research assistant to Professor [[Arthur R. Miller]] on the supplement to ''Federal Practice and Procedure'', co-authored by Miller, [[Charles Alan Wright]], and [[Edward H. Cooper]].<ref name="LQN"/><ref name="CV"/>
==Career== Pottow served as a [[law clerk]] to Judge [[Guido Calabresi]] of the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit|U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit]] from 1997 to 1998 and to [[Chief Justice of Canada|Chief Justice]] [[Beverley McLachlin]] of the [[Supreme Court of Canada]] from 1998 to 1999.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Pursglov"/><ref name="Regents"/> Pottow entered [[Practice of law|private practice]], first as a litigation associate at [[Hill & Barlow]] in Boston from 1999 to 2002,<ref name="LQN"/> and then as [[of counsel]] at [[Weil, Gotshal & Manges]] in New York from 2002 to 2003.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Regents"/><ref name="CV"/>
Pottow joined the Michigan Law faculty in 2003 and received [[tenure]] in 2008.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Regents"/> At Michigan, Pottow has taught international bankruptcy, bankruptcy, [[contract]]s, [[secured transactions]], [[law and economics]] and other business courses, and served as the project director of the National Consumer Bankruptcy Project.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="LQN"/> Pottow has testified before [[United States congressional committees|congressional committees]] several times.<ref>[http://judiciary.house.gov/hearings/pdf/Pottow090728.pdf Testimony] before the [[United States House of Representatives Committee on the Judiciary]], Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law, ''[[Medical Debt]]: Is Our Healthcare System Bankrupting Americans?'' (July 28, 2009).</ref><ref>[http://www.judiciary.senate.gov/pdf/10-20-09%20Pottow%20Testimony.pdf Testimony] and [http://www.c-spanarchives.org/program/289547-1 video] before the [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]], Subcommittee on Administrative Oversight and the Courts, ''[[Medical debt|Medical Debt]]: Can Bankruptcy Reform Facilitate a Fresh Start'' (Oct. 20, 2009).</ref> In 2009, Pottow, [[Steven P. Croley]], and [[Eric Posner]] were commissioned by the Troubled Asset Relief Program Congressional Oversight Panel to provide outside legal opinions on the [[Home Affordable Modification Program]] (HAMP) and TARP.<ref name="CV"/><ref>[http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CHRG-111shrg55737/html/CHRG-111shrg55737.htm Congress Oversight Panel: April Oversight Report] (Apr. 14, 2010). Government Printing Office.</ref>
Pottow has written on the "[[Sticky (economics)|stickiness]] of [[default rule]]s,"<ref>Omri Ben-Shahar & John A. E. Pottow, ''[http://www.law.fsu.edu/journals/lawreview/downloads/333/ben-shahar.pdf On the Stickiness of Default Rules]'', 33 Fla. St. U. L. Rev. 651 (2006).</ref> on elder bankruptcy,<ref>John A. E. Pottow, ''The Rise in Elder Bankruptcy Filings and Failure of U.S. Bankruptcy Law'', 19 Elder L.J. 119 (2011).</ref> and on the effects of the [[Bankruptcy Abuse Prevention and Consumer Protection Act]] of 2005, which significantly revised the [[Title 11 of the United States Code|U.S. Bankruptcy Code]].<ref>Robert M. Lawless, Angela K. Littwin, Katherine M. Porter, John A. E. Pottow, Deborah K. Thorne, & Elizabeth Warren, ''Did Bankruptcy Reform Fail? An Empirical Study of Consumer Debtors'', 82 Am. Bankr. L.J. 349 (2008); John A. E. Pottow, ''The Totality of the Circumstances of Debtor's Financial Situation in a Post-Means Test World'', 71 Mo. L. Rev. 1053 (2006).</ref> He has critiqued the nondischargeability of [[Student loans in the United States|student loan debt]] in [[Chapter 7, Title 11, United States Code|personal bankruptcy]] proceedings.<ref name="Regents"/><ref>''The Nondischargeability of Student Loans in Personal Bankruptcy Proceedings: The Search for a Theory'', Canadian Bus. L. J. 44, 245-78, no. 2 (2007). ''See also'' Deanne Loonin, Guest Post, [http://www.newamerica.net/blog/higher-ed-watch/2008/bankrupt-policy-8753 A Bankrupt Policy] (Dec. 3, 2008 11:45 A.M.). [[New America Foundation]].</ref> Pottow has also written extensively on international business law issues.<ref name="Regents"/> He was elected to the International Insolvency Institute in 2010 and won the Institute's first annual prize for international insolvency research.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref>[http://www.iiiglobal.org/index.php?option=com_juser&view=userlist&layout=profile&id=358 Pottow, John A. E.], International Insolvency Institute (accessed Nov. 10, 2012).</ref><ref>[https://www.law.umich.edu/historyandtraditions/faculty/Faculty_Lists/Alpha_Faculty/Documents/Law_Quad_Note/Pottow_John_A_E_2006.pdf Faculty], ''L. Quad. Notes'' (spring 2006). The prize was for the paper, ''Greed and Pride in International Bankruptcy: The Problems of and Proposed Solutions to "Local Interests"'', 106 Mich. L. Rev. 1899 (2006).</ref>
Pottow has provided commentary on legal issues in a variety of forums including ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'',<ref>Ken Belson and Alison Leigh Cowan, ''[https://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/01/sports/baseball/01madoff.html Mets Owners Hope Courts Will Limit Liability]'', N.Y. Times (Feb. 28, 2011).</ref> ''[[USA Today]]'',<ref>Dennis Cauchon, [http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/companies/management/story/2012-01-22/bankruptcy-a-reprieve-for-some-companies/52745792/1 Bankruptcy a Reprieve For Some Companies], ''USA Today'' (Jan. 22, 2012).</ref> and [[NPR]].<ref name="Michigan"/><ref name="Pursglov"/><ref>''E.g.'', [http://www.c-span.org/Events/John-Pottow-University-of-Michigan-Law-Professor/13954-1/ interview] on ''[[Washington Journal]]'', C-SPAN.</ref> He has been an [[expert witness]] in several commercial law cases.<ref name="CV"/> He is a member of the [[American Bankruptcy Institute]] and is a member of the ''[[American Bankruptcy Institute Law Review]]'' advisory board.<ref>[http://www.abiworld.org/Content/NavigationMenu/Publications/ABILawReview/AdvisoryBoard/ABI_Law_Review_Advi1.htm ABI Law Review Advisory Board], American Bankruptcy Institute (accessed Nov. 10, 2012).</ref> He won the 2005 L. Hart Wright Award for Excellence in Teaching at Michigan in 2005.<ref name="Michigan"/> Pottow was a [[visiting professor]] at Harvard in fall 2008.<ref name="CV"/>
Pottow was [[Admission to the bar in the United States|admitted to the bar]] in [[Massachusetts]] (in 1999) and Michigan (in 2011).<ref name="State Bar"/><ref name="Michigan"/><ref>[http://massbbo.org/bbolookup.php Massachusetts Board of Bar Overseers - Attorney Lookup] (search for "John Pottow").</ref> He is also a licensed [[barrister]] and [[solicitor]] in [[Ontario]].<ref name="Michigan"/>
Pottow is an occasional contributor to ''Credit Slips'', a scholarly blog on credit, finance, and bankruptcy.<ref name="Michigan"/><ref>[http://www.creditslips.org/creditslips/PottowAuthor.html Posts] by John A. E. Pottow, ''Credit Slips: A Discussion of Credit, Finance, and Bankruptcy''.</ref>
==Personal life== Pottow is married to Dr. Reshma Jagsi, a [[radiation oncologist]] and professor at the [[University of Michigan Medical School]]; they have two children.<ref>[http://rwjfpfsp.stanford.edu/meet/2012/jagsi.html Reshma Jagsi - Physician Faculty Scholars], [[Robert Wood Johnson Foundation]]</ref><ref>[http://sitemaker.umich.edu/jagsi/home Reshma Jagsi], University of Michigan Heath System.</ref> Pottow holds [[Citizenship in the United States|American]], [[Canadian nationality law|Canadian]], and [[Citizenship of the European Union|European Union citizenship]].<ref name="Pursglov"/>
Pottow is a political [[Independent (voter)|independent]].<ref>[http://www.creditslips.org/creditslips/2012/10/elizabeth-warren-ltv-steel.html Elizabeth Warren & LTV Steel], ''Credit Slips'' (Oct. 4, 2012 9:34 PM); ''[http://www.creditslips.org/creditslips/2012/11/bankruptcy-and-politics-junior-senator-from-massachusetts-edition.html Bankruptcy and Politics: Junior Senator from Massachusetts Edition]'', Credit Slips (Nov. 11, 2012, 4:08 PM).</ref> He speaks [[American Sign Language]] and [[French language|French]].<ref name="CV"/>
